Hi guys I'm here filming a brand new
series of Quick and Easy 5 Ingredient

Food. We've got loads of amazing dishes
this year. I want to give you a nice

little megamix, a sneak peek of some of
the cooking! Enjoy. Spicy Nduja

Vongole. A souped-up spicy seafood
delight for two. Delicious. I love this

kind of cooking! We've got a pan on
boiling water. Salt that. We've got

linguine. Cook it about 1 minute less
then it says on the packet. Parsley. Just

chop this up. Now the clams, the vongole
as they call them, any that don't close

when you tap them you can throw them
away.

So let's get cooking. Incredible nduja
goes in. It's fast, it's furious, it smells

incredible. Then we're gonna go in with
our clams, followed by just a little

glass of ros√©, and some for me.
Beautiful. Give it a shake. Go in with

most of the parsley. Lid on top. Simply
cook for 3 or 4 minutes.

They're all just pinging open. Drain
your pasta and that's gonna start

cooking into all the juices coming out
of the fantastic vongole.

Wow! What a treat. It makes me very
very happy. That my friends is a true joy.

Go make some. The easiest tastiest finger
food you'll ever make.

Sticky kickin chicken wings.
Asian-inspired with teriyaki, spring

onions, chili, sesame seeds, brilliant
combination. So first up I'm gonna put a

pan on. Lovely sesame seeds into the pan,
make them nice and crunchy and golden

and there's one rule you need to have a
pan that snug-fitting for the amount of

chicken wings that you're gonna do. Go in
with our lovely chicken wings. Just one

minute on each side. Then we go in with
the chili. Shake it around. We're gonna

break the frying with adding the kind of
key flavour really, teriyaki. We're gonna

go in with just enough boiling water to
cover the chicken and by the time it

reduces to a glaze again and starts to
fry again, you know the meat's tender and

delicious. So leave this for 35 to 40
minutes. Starting to caramelise a little

bit. Add a little slug of red wine vinegar,
put that sourness on there. Look at that!
Beautiful spring onions, sesame seeds.

It's sweet, it's sour, it's kind of like it's got a
bit of everything going on there.

That meat is so tender and so delicious,
and they're always messy right. There's

nothing you can do about that.
I'm going to eat the rest in private.

A classic veggie dish reworked, revved up
and ridiculously tasty. My baked garlicky

mushrooms.
It's a classic! Real comfort food is a

beautiful thing. So first up we start
with the mushroom itself. Peel the skin,

it makes the underside of the mushroom
totally exposed for flavour. Don't throw

these away because they're also really
really tasty. Get yourself four cloves of

garlic, fresh sage, mix cherry tomatoes,
olive oil, a pinch of salt, a pinch of

pepper, and red wine vinegar. Dress it all
up. Pick out 10 or 12 leaves of sage that

have been dressed, and some nice little
garlic slices. When we put the cheese on

later I'm gonna put these on top. Pop the
mushrooms in. This goes into an oven for

just 10 minutes and now cheese! Melted
cheese, come on. A nice cheddar. Little

slithers on the mushroom and then put a
sage leaf and a piece of garlic on top. I'm

gonna whack it back in the oven now
for another 15 minutes.
Oh look at that! So good! Oh! Baked mushrooms.
Mmm! Wowzers! Got a winner there.
